See Fig. 2A and p. 928, where sparse fibers, with appearance of axons-of-passage, are in layer III of their COa, corresponding to BMAa of Swanson (2004).

The authors attribute the sparse labeled axons as probably due to contamination of the BMAp (their AB) itself by the injection site (p. 228). The PAA of Swanson (2004) is roughly equivalent to the PAC of Majak & Pitkänen.

No transported label extends beyond the hippocampal formation into the rest of the cortex (on either side) from the CA2 injection site (Fig. 18). Compare Fig. 17 with Swanson (2004) Atlas Level 36.

One Fluoro-Gold injection was apparently centered in AUDv with minimal involvement of AUDp or TEAa: experiment SA1 (see Figs. 3, 16A), with the injection site probably mapping onto AUDv on Swanson (2004) Atlas Levels 35-38. See retrograde labeling between auditory and visual cortical areas.

Two Fluoro-Gold injections were centered in AUDp with minimal involvement of AUDv,d,po: experiments AV11 & SA3 (see Fig. 3). Retrograde labeling in the vicinity of PTLp (between visual and auditory areas) is weak at best (Figs. 6C, 16B).

One Diamidino Yellow injection was apparently centered in AUDd with minimal involvement of AUDp: experiment SA4 (see Figs. 3 & 16C). See retrograde labeling in region between auditory and visual areas.
